prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
The witness Stickler describes the moment of the crime, where a person pulling a noodle stand was killed.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A pianist who can't play a lick. Formerly an ace defense attorney of some renown.
Character 1
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: Future stage magician in training. Apparently, the daughter of Phoenix Wright.
Character 2
Name: Dr. Hickfield
Description: A suspicious-looking fellow, though he apparently is Mr. Wright's physician.
Character 3
Name: Guy Eldoon
Description: Proprietor of the noodle stand "Eldoon's Noodles".
Character 4
Name: Plum Kitaki
Description: Wife to the 4th Kitaki Family boss. Busy cleaning up paint spilled by her front gate.
Character 5
Name: ??? → Alita Tiala
Description: Mysterious woman encountered outside People Park. She seemed concerned...
Character 6
Name: ??? → Ema Skye
Description: Detective in a white lab coat. Apparently in an extremely touchy mood.
Character 7
Name: Wocky Kitaki
Description: The defendant. Heir to the Kitaki Family empire, and Alita Tiala's fiancé.
Character 8
Name: ??? → Klavier Gavin
Description: Spitting image of Mr. Gavin. Blew in like the wind and left like the wind.
Character 9
Name: Pal Meraktis
Description: The victim. Director of the Meraktis Clinic. Died pulling the noodle stand.
Character 10
Name: Winfred Kitaki
Description: 4th Boss of the Kitaki Family. Wocky's father. Wears an apron. (Don't ask.)
Character 11
Name: Wesley Stickler
Description: Junior in Science at Ivy University. The witness. A man concerned with "truth".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Map
Description: Shows the area around Mr. Wright's office. Click here for details.
Evidence 2
Name: Bowl
Description: Custom-made Eldoon's Noodles bowl. Decorated with the Eldoon's Noodles mascot.
Evidence 3
Name: Slippers
Description: Slippers for patients at the Meraktis Clinic. Was found in front of Kitaki Mansion. Slippers used by patients at the Meraktis Clinic. Big toe print found in left slipper.
Evidence 4
Name: Mirror
Description: Torn off the car that hit Mr. Wright. Was found in front of Kitaki Mansion. Torn off the car that hit Mr. Wright. Fits car at the Meraktis Clinic.
Evidence 5
Name: Cell Phone
Description: Found in the Meraktis Clinic garage beneath a car. Who could have dropped it? Found in the Meraktis Clinic garage beneath a car. Property of Wesley Stickler.
Evidence 6
Name: Trucy's Panties
Description: Prop for performing magic. Found in exhaust pipe of a car at the Meraktis Clinic.
Evidence 7
Name: Letter of Request
Description: Letter of request from Alita Tiala for the legal defense of her fiancé, Wocky Kitaki.
Evidence 8
Name: White Powder → Fingerprint Powder
Description: Mysterious white powder with the alleged ability to improve Detective Skye's mood. A memento of Wright and Skye. Examine fingerprints to detect and match prints.
Evidence 9
Name: Bloomers → Little Plum's Bloomers
Description: Found in a trash can at People Park. Distinctive bloomers, to say the least. Found in a trash can at People Park. Stolen by Wesley Stickler.
Evidence 10
Name: Knife
Description: Also known as a "shiv". Found at the crime scene bearing Wocky's prints.
Evidence 11
Name: Meraktis's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: June 14, after 10 PM. Cause of death: Single bullet to the right temple.
Evidence 12
Name: Noodle Stand
Description: Mr. Eldoon's noodle stand. Victim died pulling it. [caption] A sign reads "ELDOON".
Evidence 13
Name: Wocky's Check-Up Report
Description: Results from a check-up performed in June. Metallic object found near heart.
Evidence 14
Name: Pistol
Description: Weapon left at the crime scene. Two rounds were fired. Fingerprints were wiped.
Evidence 15
Name: Detective Skye's Orders
Description: "Allow clinic access to this magician and attorney, in Prosecutor Gavin's name."
Evidence 16
Name: Sandals → Alita's Sandals
Description: Cute women's sandals. Found in the Meraktis Clinic foyer. Women's sandals found in the Meraktis Clinic foyer. Big toe print found on left sandal. Present from Wocky, found in Meraktis Clinic foyer. Big toe print found on left sandal.
Evidence 17
Name: Lamp
Description: Found in the Meraktis Clinic office with a broken bulb and a red stain on the cord.
Evidence 18
Name: Wocky's Chart
Description: Found in the Meraktis Clinic safe.  Signed by nurse Alita Tiala.
Evidence 19
Name: Bullet
Description: Found in the Meraktis Clinic safe. Squished from impact with the back of the safe.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night, I passed through the park on my way home from shopping... when I saw them!
Person: Stickler
Testimony 1
Testimony: One man, pulling a stand. Another man, facing him.
Person: Stickler
Testimony 2
Testimony: I saw them quite clearly. The man facing the victim was the defendant.
Person: Stickler
Testimony 3
Testimony: In his hand he held... yes, a pistol! It was pointed at the man pulling the stand.
Person: Stickler
Testimony 4
Testimony: A shot! The bullet hit the man pulling the stand from the front, square in the forehead!
Person: Stickler

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other here. So, the witness Stickler has given several testimonies about the crime. Let's go through them one by one and check against the evidence list.

First, Testimony 0 says he saw them in the park when he was passing by. Testimony 1 mentions a man pulling a stand and another facing him. Testimony 2 identifies the defendant (Wocky Kitaki) as the one facing the victim. Then Testimony 3 says the defendant had a pistol pointed at the victim. Testimony 4 claims the bullet hit the victim in the forehead from the front.

Looking at the evidence, the Autopsy Report (Evidence 11) states the cause of death was a single bullet to the right temple. Wait, the testimony says the bullet hit the forehead, but the autopsy says right temple. That's a contradiction. But wait, the testimony says "square in the forehead" but the autopsy says right temple. Those are different locations. So that's a possible contradiction.

But let me check the other pieces. Also, the Pistol (Evidence 14) mentions two rounds fired. The bullet in Evidence 19 is squished from impact with the safe, which might relate to another shot. Maybe the bullet in the safe is from a different shot, but the victim was killed by a bullet to the temple. Hmm. But the main contradiction here is between Testimony 4 (shot in forehead) and Autopsy Report (bullet to right temple). However, the Autopsy is Evidence 11 and Testimony 4 is Testimony 4. So that would be a pair.

Alternatively, maybe another contradiction. Let's check other testimonies. Testimony 4 says the shot hit the forehead, but the autopsy says right temple. So that's a direct contradiction between Testimony 4 and Evidence 11. So that's one possibility.

But the user wants only one pair. Let me see. Are there any other contradictions? For example, the slippers (Evidence 3) have a big toe print. Alita's Sandals (Evidence 16) also have a big toe print. Maybe that's related to someone else being involved, but how does that contradict a testimony?

Alternatively, the Mirror (Evidence 4) is from the car that hit Phoenix, found in front of Kitaki Mansion. But how does that relate to the testimonies? Maybe not directly contradicting a testimony.

Looking back, the key contradiction is the location of the bullet wound. The witness says forehead, autopsy says right temple. Therefore, Evidence 11 (Autopsy Report) contradicts Testimony 4. So the pair would be evidence 11 and testimony 4. But the question is to output the evidence number and testimony number. Evidence 11 is the autopsy report, Testimony 4 is the fourth testimony. So JSON would be {"evidence": 11, "testimony": 4}.

{"evidence": 11, "testimony": 4}

response:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So, first, I need to go through each testimony and check if any of the evidences directly contradict what's being said.

The testimonies are all from Stickler. Let's look at each one:

Testimony 0: "As soon as the killer raised his pistol, I took action." So Stickler claims he acted immediately when the killer raised the gun. Not sure which evidence contradicts this yet.

Testimony 1: He told them to cease with composure. Hmm.

Testimony 2: The victim turned towards his voice, then a shot rang out. So the victim was reacting to Stickler's shout, leading to the shot.

Testimony 3: The defendant (Wocky) got scared and acted cowardly.

Testimony 4: The killer tossed the pistol and fled.

Now, looking at the evidence. Let's check each one for possible contradictions.

Evidence 14: Pistol. It says two rounds were fired, but the fingerprints were wiped. But Stickler's testimonies don't mention the number of shots. Maybe not directly related.

Evidence 11: Autopsy report says cause of death is a single bullet to the right temple. If the testimony says two shots were fired, but the autopsy says one bullet, that could be a contradiction. Wait, but the Pistol (Evidence 14) says two rounds were fired. Autopsy says one killed him, so maybe the other shot missed. But that's not a direct contradiction with testimony. Let's see.

Testimony 2 says a shot rang out when the victim turned. If only one shot was the fatal one, but the pistol had two fired, maybe that's a point. But the testimonies don't mention the number of shots. Maybe not.

Looking at Testimony 4: Tossing the pistol aside. The pistol was left at the scene (Evidence 14), which aligns.

Wait, Evidence 5: Cell Phone found under a car at Meraktis Clinic, belongs to Wesley Stickler. But how does that relate to his testimony? If Stickler was at the scene, maybe his phone being at the clinic's garage contradicts his presence elsewhere. But the testimonies are about the crime scene, which is where the noodle stand was. The clinic's garage is a different location. Maybe not directly conflicting.

Evidence 16: Alita's Sandals have a big toe print on left sandal. Evidence 3: Slippers from Meraktis Clinic also have big toe print. Maybe same person wore both? If Alita was involved, but how does that contradict the testimony?

Wait, the victim (Meraktis) died pulling the noodle stand (Evidence 12). Stickler's testimony says the killer (defendant Wocky) shot him when he turned towards Stickler's voice. But the autopsy says the cause is a single bullet to the right temple. Let's think about the direction. If the victim turned towards Stickler's voice, his right temple would be facing away from the shooter if the shooter was in front. Hmm, maybe positioning. But not sure.

Another angle: The knife (Evidence 10) has Wocky's prints, but the murder was by pistol. So maybe the knife isn't the murder weapon, so that's not a contradiction.

Evidence 19: Bullet found in the safe, squished. So maybe there was a second shot that hit the safe. That connects to the pistol's two rounds fired. If the testimony says the killer fired once (when the victim turned), but there were two shots, perhaps the second shot is unaccounted for. But Stickler's testimony doesn't mention the number of shots. So maybe that's not the contradiction.

Wait, Testimony 0 says Stickler took action when the killer raised the pistol. If Stickler took action, maybe he tried to intervene. But what evidence shows that his account is false? Let's check Evidence 5 again: his cell phone was found under a car at the clinic's garage. If the crime happened at the noodle stand (victim pulling it), but Stickler's phone was at the clinic, maybe he wasn't at the crime scene. So if his testimony claims he was there and took action, but his phone was elsewhere, that's a contradiction. However, the timeline might matter. If the crime was on June 14 after 10 PM (Autopsy report), and the phone was left at the clinic's garage, perhaps he was there at some point. But unless the time of the crime and the phone's presence at the clinic happen at the same time, it's hard to say.

Alternatively, Evidence 9: Bloomers stolen by Stickler. If he stole them, maybe he's not a reliable witness. But how does that directly contradict his testimony?

Wait, Testimony 3 says the defendant (Wocky) appeared frightened and was cowardly. But Wocky's Check-Up report (Evidence 13) mentions a metallic object near his heart. If that's a bullet, maybe he has a medical condition that affects his ability to act. But not sure if that's a contradiction.

Looking at the Mirror (Evidence 4) which was torn off the car that hit Phoenix, found at Kitaki Mansion. The mirror fits a car from Meraktis Clinic. So the clinic's car was involved in hitting Phoenix. Maybe connects to someone from the clinic being involved in another incident, but how does that relate to the testimonies?

Evidence 17: Lamp in the clinic office with broken bulb and red stain on cord. Maybe a struggle happened there, but not directly related to the testimony about the crime scene.

Wait, Testimony 2 says that when the victim turned towards Stickler's voice, a shot rang out. The autopsy says the bullet entered the right temple. If the victim turned towards Stickler, his right temple would be on the side opposite to where Stickler is. So the shooter would have to be on the victim's right side. But if the defendant was in front, maybe the positioning is off. Alternatively, if the shooter was behind the victim when he turned, but that's speculative.

Alternatively, the Noodle Stand (Evidence 12) has a sign reading "ELDOON". The victim was pulling the stand. If the shooter was behind the stand, perhaps the bullet trajectory would be from a different angle. But without a diagram, hard to tell.

Wait, looking at Evidence 16 (Alita's Sandals) and Evidence 3 (Slippers), both have big toe prints. That suggests the same person wore both, maybe. If Alita's sandals were found at the clinic, and the slippers (from clinic patients) were found at Kitaki Mansion, maybe Alita was at the clinic and left her sandals there. But how does that contradict Stickler's testimony?

Alternatively, the cell phone (Evidence 5) belonging to Stickler found under a car at the clinic's garage. If Stickler was present at the clinic's garage, perhaps during the time of the crime, then his testimony about witnessing the crime at the noodle stand would be a contradiction. Because if his phone was under the car at the clinic, maybe he was there instead of the crime scene. But the crime scene is where the noodle stand was (victim died pulling it), which is a different location. So if Stickler's phone was found at the clinic's garage, which is not the crime scene, that might suggest he wasn't present where he claims to have witnessed the crime. Therefore, his testimony about being at the crime scene and taking action (Testimony 0, 1, 2, etc.) would be contradicted by his phone being elsewhere. That could be the contradiction.

So the pair would be Evidence 5 (Cell Phone belonging to Stickler found at the clinic's garage) and Testimony 0 (Stickler claims he was at the crime scene when the killer raised the pistol). If his phone was under a car in the clinic's garage, which is a different location, then he couldn't have been at both places at the same time. Therefore, this contradicts his testimony about being present at the crime scene to witness the event.

{"evidence": 5, "testimony": 0}
